resources.string: UR Global is University Residences program for first-year international students who live on campus. Our program connects them to on-campus resources and organize free events throughout the semester.
Our mission is to help first-year international students transition from their home culture to the American way of life through:
Social and educational events throughout the year
Offer unique opportunities to make new friends
Peer Educators are the mentors and leaders in UR Global. In order to qualify, they must study at Purdue for at least one semester and maintain a minimum of a 2.5 GPA.
Participate in UR Global events and mentor new international students
Free attendance to all UR Global events
Opportunities to connect with Purdue alumni
Develop your skills set and strengthen your resume
Make new friends and get the most of our your Purdue experience!
Past and current Peer Educators have gone on to do amazing things at Purdue. Some examples include:
For more information, click below and visit our Facebook page
One of the events that student anticipated the most as it is one of the biggest events that UR Global do annually.
Peer educators gained leadership experience by leading students around the park.
Everyone had fun and get to know each other better after getting on crazy rides.
It is only 50$ including transportation, ticket and food! Even cheaper for peer educators!
Location: Vawter Media Room in Windsor Hall (entrance opposite Starbucks on 3rd street)
We have our next event this coming Sunday, Nov 6th from 5-7 pm at the Vawter Media Room in Windsor Hall (entrance opposite Starbucks on 3rd street).
We will be hosting all of Purdue's Cultural centers in the cozy setting of the Vawter room. We will be playing fun games and there will be food!!
If you plan on attending, please make sure to confirm here
